publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-3915 Stuart McMillan: Inverclyde Schools Nominated for Honours at the 2009 Scottish Education Awards—That the Parliament congratulates the Inverclyde schools of Notre Dame High School and St Kenneth’s Primary School, both in Greenock, for being nominated for the forthcoming 2009 Scottish Education Awards, which take place in Glasgow on Tuesday 16 June; notes that Gerard Gordon, a principal music teacher at Notre Dame High School, has been selected as a finalist for Teacher of the Year and that staff and pupils from St Kenneth’s Primary School have been nominated for the Health and Wellbeing Award to celebrate their proactive and successful approach to improving the health of children; commends all those who have been involved in receiving nominations, and wishes them the very best at the awards ceremony in Glasgow. Supported by: Alasdair Allan*, Bill Kidd*, Robin Harper*
S3M-3915 Inverclyde Schools Nominated for Honours at the 2009 Scottish Education Awards (lodged on 15 April 2009) Bill Wilson*
S3M-3915 Inverclyde Schools Nominated for Honours at the 2009 Scottish Education Awards (lodged on 15 April 2009) Gil Paterson*
S3M-3915 Inverclyde Schools Nominated for Honours at the 2009 Scottish Education Awards (lodged on 15 April 2009) Maureen Watt*
